intro: Hieracium pycnocranum, commonly known as the dense-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense, rounded heads, which give the plant its common name. Hieracium pycnocranum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
